text: Robert Evelyn Freeth AARE (b Dublin 7 April 1886 - d Perth, WA 16 September 1979)Freeth Notes was an Anglican priestCrockford's Clerical Directory 1955-56 p408: Oxford: OUP, 1955 and educator.GGS Freeth was the son of Evelyn Freeth, a civil servant who became an expert on death duties. He was educated at Selwyn College, Cambridge and ordained in 1910. After missionary service in Melanesia he served his title at Christ Church, North Adelaide. He was Priest in charge of Angaston from 1914 to 1915. He then taught at King's School, Parramatta; St Andrew's Cathedral School, Sydney; Sydney Church of England Grammar School; and Guildford Grammar School, Perth, where he was Head Master from 1928 to 1950. He became Archdeacon of Perth, WA in 1952; and Assistant Bishop of Perth in 1957. He retired in 1963. ==References== Category:20th- century Anglican priests Category:Archdeacons of Perth, WA Category:Australian headmasters Category:Alumni of Selwyn College, Cambridge Category:Assistant bishops in the Anglican Diocese of Perth Category:1886 births Category:Clergy from Dublin (city) Category:1979 deaths
title: Robert Freeth
